meanings.definition: To make something seem larger, more important, or more extreme than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She was overexaggerating her role in the school play.
meanings.sent2: Stop overexaggerating the size of that spider!
meanings.sent3: He kept overexaggerating his fishing skills to impress his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement over the new movie was like overexaggerating a small event into a grand celebration.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was full of overexaggerating claims to win votes.

meanings.sent1: The news report was overexaggerating the severity of the storm.
meanings.sent2: Why do you always overexaggerate your accomplishments?
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overexaggerate his height made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, overexaggerating the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes overexaggerated the beauty of the landscape.
